Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat, such as a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot, and include different types of living things found there (e.g., trees, grasses, bushes, lizards, squirrels).
The student can draw a water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake, and include different types of living things found there (e.g., fish, clams, aquatic plants).
The student can make comparisons by drawing and labeling the different kinds of plants and animals in each habitat.
The student can demonstrate patterns by showing how certain plants and animals belong to specific habitats and not others.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly show the diversity of life in each habitat.
